page.title: 01ART AND CRAFT
page.content:
ART AND CRAFT.
THERE WERE NO AMENITIES IN THIS AREA FOR REGULAR DISPLAY. THERE WERE LOCAL SHOWS FROM TIME TO TIME.MOST PEOPLE HAD SOME SORT OF HOBBY,WHICH WAS USUALLY A SPORT OR CRAFT:THE MOST COMMON CRAFTS WERE KNITTING AND SEWING. ONE LADY,HOWEVER,DID SPINNING AND WEAVING.SHE HAS BEEN RETIRED 15 YEARS THOUGH SHE USED TO BE AN ACCOUNTANT. A GENTLEMAN,WHO WAS ALSO AN ACCOUNTANT BEFORE RETIREMENT,MADE WOODEN MODELS OF GALLEONS. ANOTHER GENTLEMAN INVITED US INTO HIS ANCIENT BARN TO SEE HIS WOOD-CARVINGS. THERE WERE SEVEN BEAUTIFUL OWLS,ALL HAND-MADE,AND OTHER ANIMALS TOO.OUT SIDE THE BARN WAS A MODEL GIPSY CARAVAN,ABOUT HALF A METRE HIGH.
